name: County Hall
excerpt: Kossuth Lajos utca boasts dozens of baroque and Eclectic gems, including the delightful County Hall, with a wrought-iron grid above the main door…
detail_description:
Kossuth Lajos utca boasts dozens of baroque and Eclectic gems, including the delightful County Hall, with a wrought-iron grid above the main door portraying (from the left) Faith, Hope and Charity by Henrik Fazola, a Rhinelander who settled in Eger in the mid-18th century. Walk down the passageway, and you’ll see more of his magnificent works – two baroque wrought-iron gates that have superseded the minaret as the symbol of Eger.
The one on the right shows the seal of Heves County at the top and has a comical figure on its handle. The more graceful gate on the left is decorated with flowers and grapes.

name: Provost’s Palace
excerpt: The wrought-iron balcony and window grilles of this rococo building were the work of master craftsman Henrik Fazola.

name: Eger Art Gallery
excerpt: This collection of fine art that once hung in Eger Castle contains works by Canaletto and Ceruti, among others.

name: Neoclassical Synagogue
excerpt: The erstwhile neoclassical synagogue dating from 1845 is now partly renovated and functions as a theatre.

name: Ecclesiastical Collection
excerpt: The Ecclesiastical Collection, in the Eger Archbishop’s Palace, consists of priceless vestments, church plate and liturgical objects.

name: Dobó Bastion
excerpt: Part of the Eger Castle Complex, the terrace of the renovated Dobó Bastion (1549), which collapsed in 1976, offers stunning views of the town. Climb down…

name: Kepes Institute
excerpt: This unusual gallery exhibits the work of Hungarian-born American artist and designer György Kepes, who is celebrated for – among other things – his light…

name: Minaret
excerpt: This 40m-high minaret, topped incongruously with a cross, is one of the few reminders of the Ottoman occupation of Eger. Nonclaustrophobes can brave the…

name: Castle Casemates

name: City Under the City
excerpt: To the right of the main steps up to Eger Basilica is the entrance to the former archbishop’s cellars. A guided history-oriented tour on the hour leads…

name: Sándor Ziffer Gallery
excerpt: This gallery is housed in the former Orthodox synagogue, built in 1893 and named after the painter Sándor Ziffer (1880–1962). It has rotating exhibitions…

name: Eger Basilica
excerpt: A highlight of the town’s amazing architecture is Eger Basilica. This neoclassical monolith was designed in 1836 by József Hild, the same architect who…

name: Lyceum
excerpt: Directly east of Eger Basilica is the Zopf-style Lyceum (1765), now headquarters of the Károly Eszterházy University of Applied Sciences. It contains a…

name: Dobó István tér
excerpt: Statues of István Dobó and his comrades-in-arms routing the Turks fill Eger’s main square, which has been totally revamped in recent years. To the south…

name: Astronomy Museum

name: Eger Archbishop’s Palace

name: Eger Castle

name: Minorite Church of St Anthony of Padua
